page.title: 07Finedon The Beech Tree.
page.content: In the grounds of the derelict Finedon Hall is a 120year old Copper Beech tree which stands over 80 feet tall. Controversy has flared up about the fate of this tree. A development company that has bought the Hall and plans to convert it into luxury flats wants to chop down the tree.They maintain that it is too close to the building.A group of concerned residents is fighting to prevent the tree being removed. A tree expert has been called in and he says that in his opinion the Beech is the finest specimen he has seen in the country.A petition was organised to save the tree and it was signed by 44 of the immediate neighbours.The Council is still considering this matter.
